meanings.sent1: The premunition about the storm helped us prepare in advance.
meanings.sent2: I received a premunition about the upcoming test from my teacher.
meanings.sent3: The premunition about the surprise party almost ruined the surprise!
meanings.sent4: Her sudden silence was a premunition of the bad news to come.
meanings.sent5: The premunition of the earthquake made everyone evacuate quickly.

meanings.definition: The act of preparing or making ready in advance.
meanings.sent1: His premunition for the camping trip included packing extra food.
meanings.sent2: The premunition of the presentation helped me feel more confident.
meanings.sent3: Their premunition for the race involved stretching and warming up.
meanings.sent4: The premunition of the party decorations made the event even more special.
meanings.sent5: The premunition of the emergency kit saved us during the power outage.
